ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Before that they were living in luxury,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They were endowed with good things
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely they had lived before in luxury,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They had lived in luxury before this
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed they were among favours before this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely they were before that made to live in ease and plenty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and before that they lived at ease,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily they have been heretofore affluent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed they had been affluent before this,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They had lived before that in luxury.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:45] Indeed before that, in the world, they used to live at ease, enjoying [life’s] comforts, never wearying themselves with [an act of] obedience,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Heretofore) in the life of the world (they were effete with luxury) they were prodigal; it is also said that this means: they were immersed in comfort; and it is also said that this means: they were bewildered.
